1.text: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

2.text: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

3.text: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

4.text: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.

5.text: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

6.text: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

7.text: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

8.text: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.

9.text: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

11.text: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

12.text: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

13.text: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

14.text: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.

15.text: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

16.text: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

17.text: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

18.text: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.

19.text: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

20.text: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

21.text: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

22.text: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

23.text: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

24.text: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.

25.text: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

26.text: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

27.text: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

28.text: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

29.text: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

30.text: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

31.text: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.

32.text: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.

33.text: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

34.text: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

35.text: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.

36.text: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
